docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, Nov. 17. -- With the issuing of the Premier's most detailed statement so far of his protectionist policy, the Labor Party's declaration of its constructive program, and ex-Premier Lloyd George's castigation of the present Government, which he charged with having "muddled, messed and ultimately abandoned" America's offer of aid in Europe's troubles, today may be said to have marked the real beginning of the British electoral campaign.

headline.main: BRITISH CAMPAIGN OPENS IN EARNEST; Baldwin States Four Principal Objects of His Protective Policy.

docs.abstract: comparative statistics show costs are higher in France than in U S
